alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greenbrier; Monroe (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Watch issued April 24 at 4:52AM EDT until April 25 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EDT THIS MORNING... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Frost Advisory, temperatures as low as 34 will result in areas of frost. For the Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures as low as the lower to mid 20s and areas of frost. * WHERE...In Virginia, Tazewell, Smyth and Bath Counties. In West Virginia, Monroe and Eastern Greenbrier Counties. * WHEN...For the Frost Advisory, this morning. For the Freeze Watch, from late tonight through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
